summary: This document is a chain of emails from September to October 2020 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene and Florida State Attorney's Office Division Chief Brianna Coakley. The correspondence concerns the Southern District of New York's request for files from Florida's prior Epstein investigation to aid in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, specifically seeking grand jury transcripts and signed search warrant materials.

persons.name: Brianna Coakley
persons.role: Division Chief, Special Victims Unit, Office of the State Attorney for the 15th Judicial Circuit
persons.context: The primary contact in the Florida State Attorney's Office who is assisting the SDNY in locating Epstein-related grand jury transcripts and search warrant materials from the prior Palm Beach investigation.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The SDNY prosecutor leading the request for discovery materials from Florida's prior Epstein investigation to support the related prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Kathy Burstein
persons.role: Chief Communications Officer, Executive Clerk & Comptroller, Palm Beach County
persons.context: Identified by Coakley as a point of contact in the Palm Beach County Clerk's Office regarding a motion to access grand jury records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prior Florida investigation whose case files are being sought by the SDNY.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the SDNY's ongoing prosecution, for which the Florida Epstein files are requested as discovery.

connections.description: Prosecutors from different jurisdictions (SDNY and Florida) coordinating to share investigative files for a related federal prosecution.
Implied connection as Maxwell's prosecution is related to the prior Epstein investigation, and his files are sought for her case.
Coakley provides Burstein's contact information as a resource for accessing sealed grand jury records through the Palm Beach Clerk's Office.

events.title: SDNY Discovery Request Initiated
events.description: AUSA Maurene formally requests the Florida State Attorney's Office share its files from the prior Jeffrey Epstein investigation to aid in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.

events.title: Clarification on Grand Jury Access
events.description: Coakley informs Maurene that accessing grand jury records requires filing a motion to unseal with the court, as her office does not possess them.

events.title: Grand Jury Files Obtained
events.description: Maurene confirms she successfully obtained the grand jury files through a contact provided by Coakley and continues seeking search warrant materials.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York was actively seeking discovery from Florida's prior Epstein investigation in late 2020 to support the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Key materials being sought included transcripts from the Palm Beach grand jury proceedings and official, signed copies of the search warrant affidavit and warrant for Epstein's residence.
Access to the grand jury records required a formal motion to unseal, indicating they were still under court seal at the time.
The Palm Beach Post newspaper was involved in ongoing litigation regarding the release of the grand jury information, highlighting public interest and legal battles over transparency.
The email chain reveals procedural hurdles and inter-agency coordination between federal (SDNY) and state (Florida) prosecutors in a high-profile case.
